intro: Proclesia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy proclesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Proclesia pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
